xtext: EGRI can be used to enable end-to-end (E2E) verifiability.
EGRI can be used to enable privacy-enhanced risk-limiting audits (RLAs).
EGRI components can be used to empower individual voters to independently verify the accuracy of election results.
EGRI is compatible with in-person voting using an electronic ballot-marking device.
EGRI is compatible with in-person voting using an optical scanner capable of reading hand-marked ballots.
EGRI is compatible with in-person voting using an optical scanner capable of reading machine-marked ballots.
EGRI is compatible with voting by mail.
EGRI is compatible with Internet voting.
EGRI can prove (or fail to prove) that publicly disclosed EG ballots match reported tallies
EGRI can prove (or fail to prove) that physical ballot records used in an RLA are those produced by the voters
EGRI provides a "detailed implementation specification" and/or qualifies as a "well-documented ElectionGuard implementation"
EGRI can be used by independent parties to write ElectionGuard verifiers to confirm the consistency of election artifacts with announced election results.
EGRI can be used by independent parties to write verifiers to confirm (or refute) the consistency of election artifacts with announced election results
A 'Guardian' role exists with certain duties.
EGRI enables a Guardian to protect confidentiality of votes.
EGRI enables members of a canvassing board to serve as Guardians.
No set of guardians fewer than a quorum are able to produce the artifacts required to enable public verification of the tally.
% xnote S3.7 Josh 2025-02-25, 2025-03-18: Out of scope for EGRI: An 'Election Administrator' role exists
Note: EG defines protocols
Note: EG defines procedures
Guardians participate in a 'Key Generation Ceremony'.
At the beginning of the Key Generation Ceremony, EGRI enables each guardian to publish its public keys and proofs of knowledge of the associated secret keys.
At the beginning of the Key Generation Ceremony, EGRI enables each Guardian to receive the published keys and proofs of knowledge of the associated secret keys from the other Guardians.

EGRI enables a Guardian to determine that they have received the public keys and proofs of knowledge of the associated secret keys from all other Guardians, or identify those which have not yet been received.
EGRI enables a Guardian to encrypt to another guardian's Guardian Communication Public Key an InterGuardianShare for the Vote Encryption key.
EGRI enables a Guardian to encrypt to another guardian's Guardian Communication Public Key an InterGuardianShare for the Ballot Data Encryption key.
EGRI enables a Guardian to check for consistency any shares of other guardians secret keys it has received.

EGRI enables a Guardian to query or observe which particular shares from all other Guardians it has recieved, decrypted, checked for consistency, and verified, and which are missing, inconsistent, or failed.
Josh 2025-03-18: "The code should emit a success or failure indicator that a human can use to verify that the [received key shares] have the required properties.".
EGRI enables using the same Fixed Parameters across multiple elections
(ref: S2.b) EGRI enables Guardians to generate individual public-secret key pairs
(ref: S2.b) EGRI enables Guardians to exchange shares of secret keys
EGRI enables Guardians to destroy their secret keys.
[No specific requirement]
EGRI rejects any Election Manifest that does not contain data that makes it unique for each election
status_note: Ref: S3.1.3.a: "The manifest file must contain data that makes it unique for each election." QUESTION: How could this possibly be implemented?

xtext: EGRI rejects ElectionManifest labels that decode to a Unicode malformed surrogate pair (Unicode Category Cs). See [JSON RFC Errata 7603](https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid7603)
status_note: difficult to test because the Rust std lib rejects malformed UTF-8

xtext: EGRI rejects Contest labels that decode to a Unicode malformed surrogate pair (Unicode Category Cs). See [JSON RFC Errata 7603](https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid7603)
EGRI rejects ContestOption labels that decode to a Unicode malformed surrogate pair (Unicode Category Cs). See [JSON RFC Errata 7603](https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid7603)
EGRI rejects BallotStyle labels that decode to a Unicode malformed surrogate pair (Unicode Category Cs). See [JSON RFC Errata 7603](https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid7603)
If additional data fields are present for a Contest, they are assigned Indices continuing after the Selectable Options.
Every Ballot Style defines a label unique across all Ballot Styles in the manifest
Order of occurence is not significant within a Ballot Style Contest Index list.
For any Contest for which a Contest Selection Limit is not specfied, an effective value of 1 is used as the default.
The effective Contest Selection Limit limits the maximum total value (i.e., number of votes or voter selections) that can be assigned over all Selectable Options in that contest.
EGRI may warn if any effective Contest Selection Limit is zero
EGRI may warn if any effective Option Selection Limit is zero
The effective Option Selection Limit limits the maximum value (i.e., number of votes) that can be assigned to that particular Selectable Option.
The effective Selection Limit limits the maximum value that can be assigned to that Selectable Option

If an effective (specified or defaulted) Option Selection Limit exceeds the effective (specified or defaulted) Contest Selection Limit, EGRI applies the smaller value. EGRI may emit a diagnostic message in this case.

If the sum of all effective (specified or defaulted) Option Selection Limits for a Contest exceeds that Contest's effective (specified or defaulted) Contest Selection Limit, EGRI applies the smaller value. This is an ordinary case for which EGRI should not emit a specific diagnostic message.
Election Manifest offers optional data fields for accompanying data.
Election Manifest allows Accompanying Data Fields to be applied at the top level.

Election Manifest allows Accompanying Data Fields to be applied to Contests. Note: These are different from Additional Contest Data Fields which may be recorded after the Selectable Option Fields on a Ballot.
Election Manifest allows Accompanying Data Fields to be applied to Selectable Options.
Election Manifest allows Accompanying Data Fields to be applied to Ballot Styles.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may go beyond short labels.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may be non-unique.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about the election.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about the jurisdiction.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about the election device manufacturers.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about software versions.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about the election date.
Election Manifest Accompanying Data Fields may describe general information about the election location.
EGRI allows an Election Manifest to specify many other things, including things not listed here.
'Undervoted Contest Condition' is a per-contest state in which the sum of the voter selections is strictly less than the contest selection limit

If a Contest is specified to record Undervoted Contest Conditions, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification (None currently). The value of this additional Contest Data Field is `1` to record the Undervoted Contest Condition and `0` otherwise.
If a Contest is specified to record Undervoted Contest Conditions, any value assigned to the additional Contest Data Field does not count against the voter's Contest Selection Limit.
If a Contest is specified to record Undervoted Contest Conditions, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is either `0` or `1`.

If a Contest is specified to record Undervote Difference Count, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification. The value of this additional Contest Data Field is the (saturating) difference (i.e., nonnegative) between the effective Contest Selection Limit and the the sum of the voter selections for that Contest. This value will not exceed the effective Contest Selection Limit.

If a Contest is specified to record Undervote Difference Count, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is `0` through the effective Contest Selection Limit, inclusive.
An 'Overvoted Contest Condition' is considered to have occurred for a specific Contest on a specific Ballot when the the sum of the selections is strictly greater than the contest Selection Limit.
Election Manifest allows to specify, for each Contest, whether to record the Overvoted Contest Condition for that contest.
If not specified, EGRI does not record the Overvoted Contest Condition.

If a Contest is specified to record Overvoted Contest Conditions, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification. The value of this additional Contest Data Field is `1` to record the Overvoted Contest Condition and `0` otherwise.
If a Contest is specified to record Overvoted Contest Conditions, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is either `0` or `1`.
'Overvoted Option Condition' is a per-contest-option state in which the selection count is strictly greater than the option selection limit
Election Manifest allows to specify, for each Contest Option, whether to record the Overvoted Option Condition for that Option.
If not specified, EGRI does not record the Overvoted Option Condition.

If a Contest Option is specified to record Overvoted Option Conditions, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields, any other Contest Data Fields recording Overvoted Option Condition for lower-index Options, and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification. The value of this additional Contest Data Field is `1` to record the Overvoted Option Condition and `0` otherwise.
If a Contest is specified to record Overvoted Option Conditions, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is either `0` or `1`.
'Null Voted Contest Condition' is a per-contest state in which the sum of the voter selections is strictly less than the contest selection limit
Election Manifest allows to specify, for each Contest, whether to record the Null Voted Contest Condition for that Contest.
If not specified, EGRI does not record the Null Voted Contest Condition.

If a Contest is specified to record Null Voted Contest Conditions, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification. The value of this additional Contest Data Field is `1` to record the Null Voted Contest Condition and `0` otherwise.
If a Contest is specified to record Null Voted Contest Conditions, any value assigned to the additional Contest Data Field does not count against the voter's Contest Selection Limit.
If a Contest is specified to record Null Voted Contest Conditions, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is either `0` or `1`.
Election Manifest allows to specify, for each Contest, whether to record the Total Number Of Write-ins selected for that Contest.
If not specified, EGRI does not record the Total Number Of Write-ins.

If a Contest is specified to record Total Number Of Write-ins, an additional Contest Data Field is recorded, on every Ballot having that Contest in its Ballot Style, after the Contest Option Fields and any other additional Contest Data Fields described earlier in this specification. The value of this additional Contest Data Field is the (nonnegative integer) total number of write-ins the voter selected for that Contest. This value must not exceed the effective Contest Selection Limit.
If a Contest is specified to record Total Number Of Write-ins, any value assigned to the additional Contest Data Field does not count against the voter's Contest Selection Limit.

If a Contest is specified to record Total Number Of Write-ins, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value of the additional Contest Data Field is `0` through the effective Contest Selection Limit, inclusive.
EGRI may emit a diagnostic message if any contest specifies a number of write-in fields greater than the contest selection limit
Election Manifest allows to specify, for each Contest, the number of write-in fields available to the voter.
If a Contest is specified to supply a nonzero number of write-in fields, the Contest has that number of additional 'write-in N' voter-selectable Contest Options.

Any such write-in fields are to be labeled by the system as "write-in N", where 'N' is the 1-based index value of the write-in field. (This will be greater than the Contest Option Field Index value by the number of non-write-in voter-Selectable Options.)

The Election Manifest, for each additional 'write-in N' voter-selectable Contest Option, may specify a nonnegative integer Option Selection Limit with the same defaults and other semantics as non-write-in Contest Options. (ref: S3.1.3.g)
"Written-in" means that the election system has recorded some voter-supplied, non-empty, non-blank data associated with a contest and write-in field index value
Every write-in field that *was not* written-in MUST be assigned a value of `0`.
Every write-in field that *was* written-in MUST be assigned a value of `1` or greater, and subject to the same rules for Effective Option Selection Limit as other voter-Selectable Options.
The value of a write-in field counts against the effective Contest Selection Limit
For every Write-in field, an additional Range Proof is recorded that the encrypted value is either `0` or `1`.
Josh 2025-03-18: A write-in field can not have an effective Option Selection Limit greater than `1`.
EGRI allows to write the Election Manifest canonical representation to a file.
EGRI rejects values of `k` greater than `n`.
(Ref: S3.a.a.b) "EGRI requires that a complete new set of keys must be generated if even a single guardian is replaced"
EGRI rejects any election data unless 1 <= k <= n < 2^31
EGRI rejects Guardian labels that decode to a Unicode malformed surrogate pair (Unicode Category Cs). See [JSON RFC Errata 7603](https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid7603)

xtext: (Ref: S3.a.f.d) "Fewer than `k` distinct Guardian (Vote|Ballot Data) Encryption Secret Keys can not produce a full decryption of any tally"
The Election Record contains every Guardian's public key
The Election Record contains, for every Guardian public key, a non-interactive zero-knowledge Schnorr proof of knowledge of the associated secret key
Guardian polynomial coefficients are generated and managed in precisely the same fashion as secret keys
Any set of k guardians' private keys is sufficient to complete decryption of the tally for each contest (e.g. selection option) field
No set of fewer than `k` distinct Guardian Vote Encryption Secret Keys is sufficient to complete the the decryption of the tally for any Contest Option or additional Contest Data Field.

(Ref: S2.b) EGRI enables a Guardian `i` to encrypt to another Guardian `l` Guardian Communication Public Key a share of each of its own (Vote|Ballot Data) Encryption Secret Keys, $P_i(\ell)$ and $\hat{P}_i(\ell)$, as specified in EG DS v2.1.0 eq. 15 - 22
(Ref: S2.b) EGRI enables a Guardian to publish the encryption $E_\ell(P_i(\ell), \hat{P}_i(\ell))$ of its secret key shares $P_i(\ell)$ and $\hat{P}_i(\ell)$ for every other guardian $G_\ell$

(Ref: S3.2.2.i) EGRI enables a receiving Guardian `l` to verify or refute the Schnorr proof $C_{i,\ell,2} = (\bar c_{i,\ell},\bar v_{i,\ell})$ from sending Guardian `i` as part of the share of each of Guardian `i`'s (Vote|Ballot Data) Encryption Secret Keys as specified in EG DS v2.1.0 eq. 22.

(Ref: S2.b) "EGRI enables production of an 'Election Record'"
The Election Record is not a static fixed format. Different information is added and modified at different times.
The Election Record format must support appending new and updated information without invalidating signatures made previously.

The Election Record format must support inclusion-by-reference (eg a Ballot ID and hash value) of batches of Ballots. Rationale: For all but very small elections, it will not be practical to hold all Ballots in a single file. Neither will it be practical to place every Ballot in a separate file in a single directory.

The Election Record records any information necessary and sufficient to uniquely identify and describe the election, such as date, location, election type, etc. that is not otherwise present in the Election Manifest.
The Election Record records the Election Manifest
The Election Record records the Fixed Parameters `p`, `q`, `g`, and `r`.
The Election Record records the Varying Parameters `n` and `k`.
The Election Record records `H_P`
The Election Record records `H_B`
The Election Record records for every Guardian `1..n`: a name or label
The Election Record records for every Guardian `1..n`: the polynomial coefficients commitments
The Election Record records for every Guardian `1..n`: the polynomial coefficients the proofs of knowledge
The Election Record records for every Guardian `1..n`: the Guardian Communication Public Key
The Election Record records the Joint Vote Encryption Public Key
The Election Record records the Joint Ballot Data Encryption Public Key
The Election Record records `H_E`
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the selection encryption identifier $\id_B$,
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the selection encryption identifier hash $\HH_I$,
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: all of the encrypted selections on each ballot,

The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the proofs that each such value is an encryption of either zero or one (or more generally, the proofs that these values satisfy the respective option selection limits),
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: for every Contest, the effective Contest Selection Limit
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: for every Contest, for every Option Field, the effective Option Selection Limit
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: for every Contest, the stated and effective selection limits applied to each contest,
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: for every Contest, the proof that the number of selections made does not exceed the selection limit,
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the Ballot Weight as originally submitted with the Voter Selections
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the Ballot Weight already applied to the Ciphertexts
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the Ballot Style index,
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: device information uniquely identifying the device used for encrypting of voter selections to produce the Ballot

The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the date and time of the ballot encryption (as reported by the encrypting device) with no more than 1 second granularity
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the confirmation code produced for the Ballot
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `Cast` or `Challenged` state: the state of the ballot `Cast` or `Challenged`
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: all the information included for the Ballot in its `Challenged` state
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: the selections made for every Contest Option
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: the decrypted plaintext values of every Contest (Option or Additional) Data Field

The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: the proofs of correct decryption for every Contest (Option or Additional) Data Field and/or the Contest Data Field nonce.
The Election Record records for every Ballot in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: the date and time of the overall ballot decryption (as reported by the decrypting device)
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: some identifier uniquely identifying the Ballot Decryption Operation
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: the set of Ballots "marked for decryption"
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: the hash of the ElectionRecord at the point the Ballot Decryption Operation was initiated
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian: the Guardian Index
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian: the date and time their participation was initiated
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian: the hash of their view of the ElectionRecord at the instant this operation was initiated
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian: device information uniquely identifying the device used for their secret key operation
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian:
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation: for every participating Guardian:
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation:
The Election Record records for every Ballot Decryption Operation:
The Election Record records for every set of Ballots in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state:
The Election Record records for every set of Ballots in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: for each Guardian participating in the Decryption: the Guardian Index
The Election Record records for every set of Ballots in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: for each Guardian participating in the Decryption: the date and time of the partial decryption
The Election Record records for every set of Ballots in the `ChallengedDecrypted` state: for each Guardian participating in the Decryption: their partial decryptions
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: identifiers of the set of Ballots in the `Cast` state
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: for every (Option or Additional) homomorphically-tallied Data Field: the encrypted tally (eq. 79 pg 44)
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: for every (Option or Additional) homomorphically-tallied Data Field: the full verifiable decryption of the encrypted tally
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: for every (Option or Additional) homomorphically-tallied Data Field: the tally exponent
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: for every (Option or Additional) homomorphically-tallied Data Field: plaintext representation of the tally
The Election Record records for every Tally: for every Contest: for every (Option or Additional) homomorphically-tallied Data Field: proof of correct decryption of the tally
The Election Record records information uniquely identifying each device used for encryption of voter selections to produce any Ballot
The Election Record records an ordered list of the Ballots encrypted by each device.
The Election Record records the encrypted contest data, when available.
EGRS enables the Election Record to be produced in a format suitable for digitally signing.
EGRS enables the Election Record to be published in a format suitable to the needs of Verifier applications. For example, a directory of files accessible via HTTPS supporting efficient random access.
EGRS enables the Election Record to be published in a format suitable for archiving or bulk downloading by any interested individuals. For example, the compressed .zip and/or .tar.gz formats.
EGRI Preencrypted Ballots enable the vote-by-mail scenario.
EGRI Preencrypted Ballots enable the "precincts with central count or minimal in-precinct equipment" scenario.
EGRI Preencrypted Ballots enable back-ups for precincts which ordinarily perform encryption on demand.
EGRI enables ordinary and Preencrypted Ballots to be tallied together.
When ordinary and Preencrypted Ballots are tallied together, it does not reveal which votes came from which mode.
The Election Manifest contains a configuration setting indicating whether Preencrypted Ballots are enabled for that election.

If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled, EGRI allows to produce data necessary to print Preencrypted Ballots. Note: Referred to in the EGRS as the "Ballot Encryption Tool".
EGRI refuses to generate any Preencrypted Ballots unless the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled.
EGRI allows to record Voter Selections made on Preencrypted Ballots, if the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled.
If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are not enabled, EGRI refuses to record any Voter Selections made on Preencrypted Ballots.
For each Preencrypted Ballot generated, EGRI computes the Selection Encryption Identifier `id_B` as described in (Ref: S3.3.2.a).
For each Preencrypted Ballot generated, EGRI computes `H_I` from `H_E` and the Selection Encryption Identifier `id_B` as specified in EG DS v2.1.0 eq. 32 (Ref: S3.3.2.a).

pg. 57 EGRI `Preencrypted Ballot`, for every Contest in the BallotStyle, for every Contest Option plus an additional null selection, computes a vector `Psi_{i,m}` of length `m`, where `m` is equal to the number of Contest Options and `i` is the Contest Option index. Note1: This is captial `Psi`. Note2: Although `m` is denoted here as a subscript, it is not an index into a second dimension.

pg. 57 EGRI `PreencryptedBallot` computes `Psi_{i,m}` for `0 <= i <= m`, where `m` is equal to the number of Contest Options, `i = 0` corresponds to the null vote, and for `1 <= i` `i` is the corresponding Option Index.

pg. 57 EGRI `PreencryptedBallot` computes `Psi_{i,m}` when `1 <= i` as a length `m` vector having an encryption of `1` at (1-based) position `i`, and encryptions of `0` at all other options. Note: This corresponds to non-null vote cases.
pg. 57 EGRI `PreencryptedBallot` computes `Psi_{i,m}` when `i = 0` as a length `m` vector of encryptions of `0`. Note: This corresponds to the null vote case.
pg. 57 Note: EGRI `PreencryptedBallot`, when encrypting ContestOption vectors `Psi_{j,m}`, the encryption nonce `xi_{i,j}` is derived from `H_I` and `xi_B` as specified in eq. 121 (Ref: S4.2.1).
pg. 57 For each Preencrypted Ballot generated, EGRI computes `H_I` from `H_E` and the Selection Encryption Identifier `id_B` as specified in [eq. 121 pg. 61].
pg. 58 EGRI computes the Selection Hash `psi_i` for a single Option `i` according to [eq. 115 pg. 58]
pg. 58 "In a contest with a selection limit of L, an additional L null vectors are hashed" "where all $E_i = (\alpha_i, \beta_i)$ are encyptions of zero and `1 <= l <= L`."
pg. 58 EGRI computes the Selection Hash `psi_{m+l}` for an additional L null vector according to [eq. 114 pg. 58]
pg. 58 EGRI sorts all Selection Hashes in a contest prior to their use in the computation of the Contest Hash.
pg. 58 EGRI computes the Contest Hash `chi_l` according to [eq. 115 pg. 58]
pg. 58 EGRI computes the Confirmation Code `H_C` according to [eq. 116 pg. 58]
pg. 59 EGRI computes Ballot Chaining values for Preencrypted Ballots according to eq. 117-120 pg. 59.

pg. 59 If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled, EGRI requires that the Election Manifest specify unambiguously the Hash Trimming Function `Omega` to be used for all Preencrypted Ballots generated for the election.
pg. 59 EGRI provides one or more Hash Trimming Functions.
If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled, EGRI provides short codes to indicate undervotes
If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled, EGRI provides a "Ballot Encrypting Tool" which operates as describedin S4.2
If the Election Manifest indicates Preencrypted Ballots are enabled, EGRI produces nonces deterministically as described in eq. 121
